019package org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager;
020
021import io.kubernetes.client.custom.V1Patch;
022import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiException;
023import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.Configuration;
024import io.kubernetes.client.util.Config;
025import io.kubernetes.client.util.generic.options.PatchOptions;
026import java.io.IOException;
027import java.nio.file.Files;
028import java.nio.file.Path;
029import java.util.logging.Level;
030import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.Constants.VM_OP_GROUP;
031import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.Constants.VM_OP_KIND_VM;
032import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8s;
033import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.StartVm;
034import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.StopVm;
035import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.VmDefChanged;
036import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
037import org.jgrapes.core.Component;
038import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler;
039import org.jgrapes.core.events.HandlingError;
040import org.jgrapes.core.events.Start;
041import org.jgrapes.core.events.Stop;
042import org.jgrapes.util.events.ConfigurationUpdate;
043
044/**
045 * Implements a controller as defined in the
046 * [Operator Whitepaper](https://github.com/cncf/tag-app-delivery/blob/eece8f7307f2970f46f100f51932db106db46968/operator-wg/whitepaper/Operator-WhitePaper_v1-0.md#operator-components-in-kubernetes).
047 * 
048 * The implementation splits the controller in two components. The
049 * {@link VmWatcher} and the {@link Reconciler}. The former watches
050 * the VM definitions (CRs) and generates {@link VmDefChanged} events
051 * when they change. The latter handles the changes and reconciles the
052 * resources in the cluster.
053 * 
054 * The controller itself supports a single configuration property:
055 * ```yaml
056 * "/Manager":
057 *   "/Controller":
058 *     namespace: vmop-dev
059 * ```
060 * This may only be set when running the Manager (and thus the Controller)
061 * outside a container during development.  
062 * 
063 * ![Controller components](controller-components.svg)
064 * 
065 * @startuml controller-components.svg
066 * skinparam component {
067 *   BackGroundColor #FEFECE
068 *   BorderColor #A80036
069 *   BorderThickness 1.25
070 *   BackgroundColor<<internal>> #F1F1F1
071 *   BorderColor<<internal>> #181818
072 *   BorderThickness<<internal>> 1
073 * }
074 * 
075 * [Controller]
076 * [Controller] *--> [VmWatcher]
077 * [Controller] *--> [Reconciler]
078 * @enduml
079 */
080public class Controller extends Component {
081
082    private String namespace;
083
084    /**
085     * Creates a new instance.
086     */
087    public Controller(Channel componentChannel) {
088        super(componentChannel);
089        // Prepare component tree
090        attach(new VmWatcher(channel()));
091        attach(new Reconciler(channel()));
092    }
093
094    /**
095     * Special handling of {@link ApiException} thrown by handlers.
096     *
097     * @param event the event
098     */
099    @Handler(channels = Channel.class)
100    public void onHandlingError(HandlingError event) {
101        if (event.throwable() instanceof ApiException exc) {
102            logger.log(Level.WARNING, exc,
103                () -> "Problem accessing kubernetes: " + exc.getResponseBody());
104            event.stop();
105        }
106    }
107
108    /**
109     * Configure the component.
110     *
111     * @param event the event
112     */
113    @Handler
114    public void onConfigurationUpdate(ConfigurationUpdate event) {
115        event.structured(componentPath()).ifPresent(c -> {
116            if (c.containsKey("namespace")) {
117                namespace = (String) c.get("namespace");
118            }
119        });
120    }
121
122    /**
123     * Handle the start event. Has higher priority because it configures
124     * the default Kubernetes client.
125     *
126     * @param event the event
127     * @throws IOException 
128     * @throws ApiException 
129     */
130    @Handler(priority = 100)
131    public void onStart(Start event) throws IOException, ApiException {
132        // Make sure to use thread specific client
133        // https://github.com/kubernetes-client/java/issues/100
134        Configuration.setDefaultApiClient(null);
135
136        // Verify that a namespace has been configured
137        if (namespace == null) {
138            var path = Path
139                .of("/var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/namespace");
140            if (Files.isReadable(path)) {
141                namespace = Files.lines(path).findFirst().orElse(null);
142            }
143        }
144        if (namespace == null) {
145            logger.severe(() -> "Namespace to watch not configured and"
146                + " no file in kubernetes directory.");
147            event.cancel(true);
148            fire(new Stop());
149            return;
150        }
151        logger.fine(() -> "Controlling namespace \"" + namespace + "\".");
152    }
153
154    /**
155     * On start vm.
156     *
157     * @param event the event
158     * @throws ApiException the api exception
159     * @throws IOException Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
160     */
161    @Handler
162    public void onStartVm(StartVm event) throws ApiException, IOException {
163        patchRunning(event.name(), true);
164    }
165
166    /**
167     * On stop vm.
168     *
169     * @param event the event
170     * @throws ApiException the api exception
171     * @throws IOException Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
172     */
173    @Handler
174    public void onStopVm(StopVm event) throws ApiException, IOException {
175        patchRunning(event.name(), false);
176    }
177
178    private void patchRunning(String name, boolean running)
179            throws ApiException, IOException {
180        var crApi = K8s.crApi(Config.defaultClient(), VM_OP_GROUP,
181            VM_OP_KIND_VM, namespace, name);
182        if (crApi.isEmpty()) {
183            logger.warning(() -> "Trying to patch " + namespace + "/" + name
184                + " which does not exist.");
185            return;
186        }
187
188        // Patch running
189        PatchOptions patchOpts = new PatchOptions();
190        patchOpts.setFieldManager("kubernetes-java-kubectl-apply");
191        var res = crApi.get().patch(namespace, name,
192            V1Patch.PATCH_FORMAT_JSON_PATCH,
193            new V1Patch("[{\"op\": \"replace\", \"path\": "
194                + "\"/spec/vm/state\", "
195                + "\"value\": \"" + (running ? "Running" : "Stopped")
196                + "\"}]"),
197            patchOpts);
198        if (!res.isSuccess()) {
199            logger.warning(
200                () -> "Cannot patch pod annotations: " + res.getStatus());
201        }
202
203    }
204}
